Subject: Re: [junit] JUnit fossilized at 3.8.1?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=224061497

J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> Simon Chappell wrote:
> 
> 
>>JB, do you have more contacts than us? Could you do a little asking around?
> 
> 
> I have spoken with Kent and we have talked about what would be in the 
> next release of JUnit. I have 3.8.2 right now, and I don't know whether 
> it's been released to the public -- the most visible change is better 
> highlighting of the differences between unequal strings. :)
> 
> Expected: ab[c]def, but was: ab[dr]def
> 
> The difference is in the brackets.

This, in fact, is precisely one of the changes that I had in mind for a 
future version. Good to hear.
subject: Re: [junit] JUnit fossilized at 3.8.1?
